page.title: 12A LOCAL FARMER, CORSHAM
page.content: Guy Stafford is a dairy farmer. He has owned his 305 acre farm for thirty years. The land itself is quite stoney yet he is able to plant wheat. He has 170 friesian cows which are milked twice a day at 4.30 a.m. and 3.30 p.m.The farmer gets 13p for each litre of milk.In addition to their normal feed sugar-beet is provided at mid-day. He also has three bulls. The average price for a calf is Â£50-100 and for a cow is Â£100. He keeps 'large white' pigs for fattening and when weened a pig fetches Â£35 at market. He has between 230 and 250 pigs altogether. He has 5 tractors, trailers, balers, harvesters and mowers. He makes 2000 tons of silage a year.
